medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) characterized by the absence of T cells.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 was diagnosed immediately after birth. Patient 2 presented at two months of age with fever, tachypnea, and tachycardia, leading to respiratory arrest and subsequent death. Patient 3 was well until two and a half months of age when chronic diarrhea developed, eventually leading to respiratory distress, lethargy, and jaundice at three and a half months of age, followed by rapid progression to death within 12 hours of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A family history of severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID). Patient 1 underwent bone marrow transplantation and had full immune reconstitution three years later. Patient 2 and Patient 3 died as a result of severe complications related to SCID.
medical_history.family_history: The patients share a kindred of Mennonite descent with multiple consanguineous links, indicating hereditary aspects of the condition.
